pageContext.description:
The painting depicts a half-length portrait of the humanist and theologian Philipp Melanchthon (1497-1560) in three quarter profile, against a greenish grey background. He is wearing a fur-trimmed cloak over a bright red doublet under which a white shirt with a ruffled collar is visible at the neck. The sitter is facing to his right and holds a leather bound book in his hands. He rests his left arm on a parapet in front of him, that bears an inscription. 
[cda 2020]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 41 x 28.5 cm
[Letter from Van Ham, Cologne, 02.03.2011; Koepplin Archive]
Dimensions of support: 42 x 29 cm
[Hargesheimer online database, accessed 29.09.2020](https://www.kunstauktionen-duesseldorf.de/produkt/halbfigurenbildnis-des-philipp-melanchthon/)
pageContext.inscription:
at the bottom, on the parapet:
'IN EFFIGIEM REVERENDI VIRI D. PHILIPPI MELANTHO: // Iapete de gente prior materue Luthero // Nemo fuit, tu par dodre MELANTHON eras.'
